Line 28: Line 28:  
Interpersonal love refers to love between human beings. It is a more potent sentiment than a simple ''liking'' for another. [[Unrequited love]] refers to those feelings of love that are not reciprocated. Interpersonal love is most closely associated with [[interpersonal relationships]]. Such love might exist between family members, friends, and couples. There are also a number of psychological disorders related to love, such as [[erotomania]].
 
Interpersonal love refers to love between human beings. It is a more potent sentiment than a simple ''liking'' for another. [[Unrequited love]] refers to those feelings of love that are not reciprocated. Interpersonal love is most closely associated with [[interpersonal relationships]]. Such love might exist between family members, friends, and couples. There are also a number of psychological disorders related to love, such as [[erotomania]].
      +
Can Lust and Love be one and the same? Recent studies show that lust and love may be on the same page, if any differences can be seen than correct ("MikeatCQMS") me on my article.
  +
As it stands, throughout the period of history men and women have been obviuos as oppisite sexes. However there is a slight similiarity with male and female hormones. Lust is seen as "Love" at first sight, not knowing a person but being sexually attracted to their "body" or physical features is most common in man, although Woman is not far behind. Many people today (in fact 87%'''*''') would agree that, yes sex is a very important part of a relationship. But if you asked those same people if they could decipher and depict the difference between love and lust you just may find yourself without an answer. Take into consideration a married couple, sure they have love and at the same time have lust for one another.
  +
so we asked 20 married couples a few questions and came up with these answers
  +
Love is:
  +
Undefinable, Eternal, Beyond Life, Everlasting, Ever-Growing and Spiritually Bonding.
  +
Lust is:
  +
Sexual Temptation, Seductively Pleasurable, Love at first sight, Mortally Bonding
  +
(*2007 Census-Alberta)
 
Throughout history, [[philosophy]] and [[religion]] have done the most speculation on the phenomenon of love. In the last century, the science of [[psychology]] has written a great deal on the subject. In recent years, the sciences of [[evolutionary psychology]], [[evolutionary biology]], [[anthropology]], [[neuroscience]], and [[biology]] have added to the understanding of the nature and function of love.
 
Throughout history, [[philosophy]] and [[religion]] have done the most speculation on the phenomenon of love. In the last century, the science of [[psychology]] has written a great deal on the subject. In recent years, the sciences of [[evolutionary psychology]], [[evolutionary biology]], [[anthropology]], [[neuroscience]], and [[biology]] have added to the understanding of the nature and function of love.
